question: Question_01_(e)
sols:
Following the hint, we compute the inverse of 7 modulo 13. Then

\begin{align*}
13 &= 7(1) + 6\\
7 &= 6(1) + 1
\end{align*}

and back substituting gives
$\displaystyle 1 = 7 -6(1) = 7 - (13-7(1)) = 7(2) - 13$.

Thus, the inverse of 7 modulo 13 is 2. Hence
$\displaystyle x \equiv 2(7)x \equiv 2(4) \equiv 8 \mod{13}$ which
completes the question.
hints:
